30  class KSStep;

32  class KSIntSurfaceMultiplication :
33  public KSComponentTemplate< KSIntSurfaceMultiplication, KSSurfaceInteraction >
34  {
35  public:
36  KSIntSurfaceMultiplication();
37  KSIntSurfaceMultiplication( const KSIntSurfaceMultiplication& aCopy );
38  KSIntSurfaceMultiplication* Clone() const;
39  virtual ~KSIntSurfaceMultiplication();
40 
41  public:
42 
43  void ExecuteInteraction( const KSParticle& anInitialParticle, KSParticle& aFinalParticle, KSParticleQueue& aSecondaries );
44 
45  public:
46 
47  void SetEnergyLossFraction(double frac)
48  {
49  fEnergyLossFraction = frac;
50  };
51 
52  double GetEnergyLossFraction() const {return fEnergyLossFraction;};
53 
54  void SetEnergyRequiredPerParticle(double e)
55  {
56  fEnergyRequiredPerParticle = e*KConst::Q(); //electron volts
57  }
58 
59  double GetEnergyRequiredPerParticle() const {return fEnergyRequiredPerParticle;};
60 
61  void SetSide(std::string side_name)
62  {
63  //default is both sides of the surface execute the interaction
64  fSideName = std::string("both");
65  fPerformSideCheck = false;
66 
67  //top is the side on which the normal points outward
68  if( side_name == std::string("top") )
69  {
70  fSideName = side_name;
71  fPerformSideCheck = true;
72  fSideSignIsNegative = true;
73  }
74 
75  //bottom is the side on which the normal std::vector points inward
76  if( side_name == std::string("bottom") )
77  {
78  fSideName = side_name;
79  fPerformSideCheck = true;
80  fSideSignIsNegative = false;
81  }
82  }
83 
84  std::string GetSide() const { return fSideName;};
85 
86  private:
87 
88  bool fPerformSideCheck;
89  bool fSideSignIsNegative;
90  std::string fSideName;
91  double fEnergyLossFraction;
92  double fEnergyRequiredPerParticle;
93  };
94 
95 }
96 
97 #endif
